item.title: Version 1.0.9 Released
item.description: This version addresses some bug-fixes in the Epsilon ANT tasks. It also introduces a sortBy() operation on collections.

item.title: Version 1.0.8 Released
item.description: This version supports a number of additional features: cross-module inheritance in EML, ECL and ETL, improved performance in EMF model management, and profiling tools for measuring the performance of model management operations implemented in Epsilon languages (see the Documentation page)

item.title: Version 1.0.7 Released
item.description: In this version Exeed has been enhanced with support for additional annotations.

item.title: Version 1.0.6 Released
item.description: This version addresses a significant performance-related issue that particularly impacts cases where large models are involved. Credit to Aleksander Bandelj for identifying the issue and suggesting a solution.

item.title: Version 1.0.5 Released
item.description: In this version a bug in EVL has been fixed.

item.title: Version 1.0.4 Released
item.description: In this version a bug in the EMF model driver introduced in 1.0.3 has been fixed.

item.title: Version 1.0.3 Released
item.description: In this version support for managing XML documents has been added.

item.title: Version 1.0.2 Released
item.description: In this version EML has been separated from ECL (EML does not support match-rules any more). Examples of using the new version of EML will appear soon in the Examples section.

item.title: Version 1.0.1 Released
item.description: An update that fixes a bug in handling cross-model references in EMF

item.title: Version 1.0.0 Released
item.description: We have now implemented proper version management and integrated with the Eclipse Update Manager. Also included in this release is a new model-to-text language: the Epsilon Generation Language (EGL)

item.title: MDD-TIF case study available
item.description: An article that demonstrates using Epsilon to implement the Interactive TV Applications case study proposed by the organizers of MDD-TIF has been made available.

item.title: Epsilon plugins and bundle updated
item.description: An update to the Epsilon plugins has been released. This update includes a number of bug-fixes.

item.title: Epsilon plugins and bundle updated
item.description: An update to the Epsilon plugins has been released. This update addresses a bug found by Louis Rose in the execution engine of the Epsilon Object Language (EOL)

item.title: New tool: Exeed (EXtended Emf EDitor) added to the Epsilon bundle and plugins
item.description: Exeed is an extension of the built-in reflective EMF editor that enables customizing labels and icons without generating a dedicated tree-based editor for each .ecore metamodel

item.title: Implementation of Dijkstra's shortest path algorithm using EOL and EVL uploaded
item.description: This example contains an EVL validation module that checks that a graph is acyclic and its edges have only positive weights and an EOL program that calculates the shortest paths according to Dijkstra's algorithm.

item.title: Epsilon plugins and bundle updated
item.description: An update to the Epsilon plugins has been released. This update addresses a bug found in the execution engine of the Epsilon Validation Language (EVL)

item.title: Examples page opened and initial set of examples uploaded
item.description: We have created a page that contains working examples of Epsilon languages and uploaded an initial set of examples of using EOL, EML and ETL.

item.title: Documentation on syntax/features of Epsilon languages available online
item.description: We have released an online copy of the syntax and features of Epsilon Languages including EOL, EML, ETL and ECL.

item.title: Epsilon plugins and bundle updated
item.description: An update to the Epsilon plugins has been released. This update addresses a bug found in the execution engine of the Epsilon Transformation Language (ETL)

item.title: Epsilon plug-ins uploaded
item.description: Epsilon plug-ins have been uploaded. Also, a bundle containing Eclipse, EMF and Epsilon has been compiled to make experimenting with Epsilon easier

item.title: Epsilon source code available on CVS
item.description: Check this document for instructions on how to access the source code of Epsilon on the Eclipse CVS server.

item.title: Creation of the Epsilon component
item.description: Creation of the Epsilon component.
